description.narrative: The Netherlands and Colombia have an agreement cooperation on to exchange knowledge and strengthen public health in the Life Sciences and Health Sector (LSH). Colombia has declared cancer as an illness of national priority. The challenge for the country is cantered in integral attention and quality, in particular to early detection/screening of breast cancer. The health system in Colombia is largely privatized. 89% of the insurance companies are private and 11% are mixed. 90% or the oncological services are private. The Colombian system lacks standardized procedures and quality control for screening. Main problem is that health providers work under different standards for breast cancer screening. Treatment starts on late stages due to lack of prompt and quality diagnose, which increases the mortality rate (mainly of women). The assurance of quality control and screening at the same standard is an imperative need within the organizations that are part of the health system.The Netherlands has an added value to become a partner to support Colombia on this challenge. The Netherlands screening process is one of the most efficient in Europe and it is done by public health institutions in partnership with the Dutch Expert Centre for Screening (LRCB). LRBC is the unique organization who has integrated approach on quality assurance and quality control of breast cancer screening in the Netherlands and in Europe. The project enables the implementation of a site visit of one week by a multidisciplinary team of experts of the LRCB, who will elaborate a detailed baseline assessment of the actual breast cancer screening programme and will provide and advisory report with tailormade recommendations to the of the National Institute of Cancer of Colombia (INC).
